name: Mahavir Mandir, Patna
description: One of the most sacred Hindu temples dedicated to Lord Hanuman, known for its faith and devotion.
significance: Located near Patna Junction, Mahavir Mandir is among the most visited temples in North India and is renowned for its Ram Rasoi community kitchen and social services.

name: Vishnupad Temple, Gaya
description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, featuring a sacred footprint etched in rock.
significance: A major pilgrimage site for Pind-daan rituals. The temple houses a 40 cm footprint of Lord Vishnu on a basalt rock known as Dharmasila.

name: Jal Mandir, Pawapuri
description: A marble Jain temple situated in the middle of a lotus pond.
significance: Built at the site where Lord Mahavira attained Mahaparinirvana, the Jal Mandir is a major Jain pilgrimage destination.

name: Patan Devi Temple, Patna
description: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas dedicated to Goddess Sati.
significance: Believed to be the site where Goddess Sati’s right thigh fell. The temple is deeply connected to the origin of Patna’s name.

name: Mundeshwari Devi Temple, Kaimur
description: One of the oldest functional Hindu temples in India, dating back to 108 AD.
significance: An octagonal stone temple protected by ASI, representing rare Nagara-style architecture and continuous worship for centuries.

name: Sun Temple, Deo
description: A historic Sun temple famous for its Chhath Puja celebrations.
significance: Unique for its west-facing entrance, the temple attracts massive crowds during Chhath Puja.

name: Ajgaivinath Temple, Sultanganj
description: An ancient Shiva temple located on a rock in the Ganges river.
significance: Starting point of the Kanwar Yatra where devotees collect holy Ganga water for Deoghar.

name: Mahabodhi Temple, Bodh Gaya
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site marking Buddha’s enlightenment.
significance: The holiest site in Buddhism, housing the Bodhi Tree under which Siddhartha Gautama attained enlightenment.
